name: Rubik's Cube Solver
description:
Given a scrambled Rubik's Cube, return a string of space-separated moves which will bring the cube to a solved state.


From [The Rubik's Cube](https://www.codewars.com/kata/5b3bec086be5d8893000002e/) by sgeredos: _The Rubik's Cube is made of six faces. F(ront), L(eft), R(ight), B(ack), U(p), D(own)_ _Below a two dimensional representation of the cube._ ``` +-----+ | | | U | | | +-----+-----+-----+-----+ | | | | | | L | F | R | B | | | | | | +-----+-----+-----+-----+ | | | D | | | +-----+ ``` _On every face you can see nine stickers. Every sticker can be one of the six colors: Yellow, Blue, Red, Green, Orange, White. In this Kata they are represented with according small letters (y, b, r, g, o, w,)._ _A solved cube has on every face only one color:_ ``` +-----+ |y y y| |y y y| |y y y| +-----+-----+-----+-----+ |b b b|r r r|g g g|o o o| |b b b|r r r|g g g|o o o| |b b b|r r r|g g g|o o o| +-----+-----+-----+-----+ |w w w| |w w w| |w w w| +-----+ ``` _Every sticker on a face in this Kata has a positional number_ ``` +-----+ |1 2 3| |4 5 6| |7 8 9| +-----+ ``` So a face of the cube can be represented as a 9 item list consisting of its colors: ``` +-----+ |r o w| |b y g| --> ['r', 'o', 'w', 'b', 'y', 'g', 'b', 'r', 'y'] |b r y| +-----+ ``` The state of the cube is a 6 item list consisting of each face of the cube in this order: U L F R B D ``` +-----+ |y y y| |y y y| |y y y| [['y', 'y', 'y', 'y', 'y', 'y', 'y', 'y', 'y'], +-----+-----+-----+-----+ ['b', 'b', 'b', 'b', 'b', 'b', 'b', 'b', 'b'], |b b b|r r r|g g g|o o o| ['r', 'r', 'r', 'r', 'r', 'r', 'r', 'r', 'r'], |b b b|r r r|g g g|o o o| --> ['g', 'g', 'g', 'g', 'g', 'g', 'g', 'g', 'g'], |b b b|r r r|g g g|o o o| ['o', 'o', 'o', 'o', 'o', 'o', 'o', 'o', 'o'], +-----+-----+-----+-----+ ['w', 'w', 'w', 'w', 'w', 'w', 'w', 'w', 'w']] |w w w| |w w w| |w w w| +-----+ ```

You can return any combination of these valid moves: ``` X Y Z X' Y' Z' X2 Y2 Z2 F B L R U D F' B' L' R' U' D' F2 B2 L2 R2 U2 D2 f b l r u d f' b' l' r' u' d' f2 b2 l2 r2 u2 d2 M E S M' E' S' M2 E2 S2 ``` [Move Notation Guide](https://jperm.net/3x3/moves)


For your convenience you're given the cube_net(cube) function, which displays a two dimensional representation of a given cube. You're also given apply_moves(cube, moves) which mutates a cube given a string of moves. Thanks Hobovsky for helping format this kata
